title: 652-D
statement: D. Nested Segmentstime limit per test2 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstdinoutputstdoutYou are givennsegments on a line. There are no ends of some segments that coincide. For each segment find the number of segments it contains.InputThe first line contains a single integern(1 ≤n≤ 2·105) — the number of segments on a line.Each of the nextnlines contains two integersliandri(- 109≤li<ri≤ 109) — the coordinates of the left and the right ends of thei-th segment. It is guaranteed that there are no ends of some segments that coincide.OutputPrintnlines. Thej-th of them should contain the only integeraj— the number of segments contained in thej-th segment.ExamplesInput41 82 34 75 6Output3010Input33 41 52 6Output011

processed.result:
You are given $n$ segments on a line.  Each segment is defined by its left and right endpoints.  

For each segment, find the number of other segments that are entirely contained within it.

**Input:**

* The first line contains an integer $n$ (1 ≤ $n$ ≤ 2 ⋅ 10⁵) representing the number of segments.
* Each of the next $n$ lines contains two integers $l_i$ and $r_i$ (-10⁹ ≤ $l_i$ < $r_i$ ≤ 10⁹) representing the left and right endpoints of the $i$-th segment.

**Output:**

Print $n$ lines. The $j$-th line should contain an integer $a_j$ representing the number of segments contained within the $j$-th segment.
You are given a list of intervals on a line.  For each interval, count how many other intervals are completely inside of it.
